questions.question: In the context of Special Relativity, what is 'time dilation'?
options: The phenomenon where time appears to slow down for a moving observer
The phenomenon where time appears to speed up for a moving observer
The phenomenon where time appears to stop for a moving observer
The phenomenon where time appears to reverse for a moving observer
questions.correct_answer: The phenomenon where time appears to slow down for a moving observer

questions.question: What are 'worldlines' in the context of Relativity?
options: They represent the path of a particle in space-time
They represent the boundary of the observable universe
They represent the edge of a black hole
They represent the speed of light
questions.correct_answer: They represent the path of a particle in space-time

questions.question: In Einstein's theory of General Relativity, what does the 'equivalence principle' state?
options: Gravity and acceleration are indistinguishable
Gravity and inertia are indistinguishable
Gravity and velocity are indistinguishable
Gravity and mass are indistinguishable

questions.question: What is a 'light cone' in the context of Relativity?
options: A hypothetical shape describing the possible paths of light
A tool used to measure the speed of light
A device used in laser technology
A term used to describe the intensity of light
questions.correct_answer: A hypothetical shape describing the possible paths of light

questions.question: What is the main impact of Special Relativity on the concept of simultaneity?
options: It confirms that simultaneity is absolute
It disproves the concept of simultaneity
It suggests that simultaneity is relative to the observer
It has no impact on the concept of simultaneity
questions.correct_answer: It suggests that simultaneity is relative to the observer

questions.question: What did Einstein's General Relativity predict about light passing close to a massive object?
options: It will speed up
It will slow down
Its path will be curved
Its frequency will change

questions.question: In the context of General Relativity, what does 'geodesic' mean?
options: The shortest path between two points in space
The curved path of an object under the influence of gravity
The curvature of space-time due to mass and energy
The path of light in the presence of gravity
questions.correct_answer: The shortest path between two points in space

questions.question: What does the 'cosmological constant' in Einstein's field equations represent?
options: The average density of matter in the universe
The speed of light
The energy density of the vacuum of space
The rate of expansion of the universe
questions.correct_answer: The energy density of the vacuum of space

questions.question: Which experiment confirmed the prediction of General Relativity about light being deflected by gravity?
options: The double-slit experiment
The Eddington experiment during the 1919 solar eclipse
The Michelson-Morley experiment
The Pound-Rebka experiment
questions.correct_answer: The Eddington experiment during the 1919 solar eclipse

questions.question: What term is used in special relativity to describe the new way of combining space and time into a four-dimensional structure?
options: Quantum Field
Minkowski Space
Einstein Field
Newtonian Space-Time
